Failure Analysis Guide

Master the art of analyzing equipment failures to prevent future incidents and optimize maintenance strategies.

Systematic Failure Analysis

Effective failure analysis is crucial for understanding root causes, preventing recurrence, and improving equipment reliability. Our systematic approach helps mining operations learn from failures and build more robust maintenance programs.

Analysis Methods

Root Cause Analysis

Systematic investigation to identify the fundamental cause of equipment failures using proven methodologies.

Failure Mode Analysis

Comprehensive evaluation of how equipment can fail and the potential consequences of each failure mode.

Statistical Analysis

Data-driven analysis of failure patterns, frequencies, and correlations to predict future issues.

Analysis Process

1
Immediate response and safety measures
2
Evidence collection and documentation
3
Timeline reconstruction
4
Root cause identification
5
Corrective action implementation
6
Follow-up and prevention measures

Common Mining Equipment Failures

Bearing Failures

Contamination, lubrication issues, and excessive loads leading to premature bearing wear and equipment breakdown.

Hydraulic System Issues

Fluid contamination, seal failures, and pressure problems causing reduced efficiency and system failures.

Electrical Failures

Motor failures, wiring issues, and control system problems affecting equipment operation and safety.

Improve Your Failure Analysis

Implement systematic failure analysis with Elysium's advanced diagnostic tools and AI-powered insights.
